content.description: The striking arete right of the large Autumn Arch corner. There were a couple of decent rest spots to shake the pump out of your right arm - that is getting most of the workout on this overhanging arete.

Climb the face past two bolts (5.11) to a ledge.  The corner is considered off route and is significantly easier.  From the ledge reach up, clip a bolt and try to unlock a baffling sequence (crux) passing two more bolts on the thinnest holds Safe Harbor has to offer.
content.location: Just right of the shared start of Locomation and Chillin' and Maxin' are prominent white stripes (hence the name).

content.description:
Climb to first very high bolt(heady). Pull bulge and climb nice face to a stance at bolt 4. Follow finger crack clipping 2 more bolts to a left facing corner with a tricky move to last bolt. The crux is balancing to the anchors on decent feet.

 "Eagles dive-bombing each other and there are no route names with eagles in them so she wanted a name with eagles - we settled on "Where Eagles Dare" - a double homage to the eagles that now frequent the cliffs, and the Clint Eastwood movie of the same name"
content.location: Between Urban Daydreams and Static cling

content.description: Climb steep face left of Wonderama

"About 20 feet left of the obvious corner of Autumn Arch. Blocky start to get established on the slabby face. Based on the streaks, it looks like the face stays wet longer than other sections. Fun, delicate climbing; a little grungy in some spots but not bad.  

  It was wet at the top on Sunday but the left-hand pocket was still pretty good and there was a dry nub for a left foot to feel just secure enough to get to the anchors." [-Mojo Monkey]
Static Cling is to the climber's right of Urban Daydreams, sharing the start of Autumn Arch but heading up the face instead of following the corner.

Climb easy ground to third bolt (5.6R) 

  The crux is at the top.   According to Jeremy (he loves this climb), the beta goes like this, "You can't fall anywhere above or below the first bolt. You also can't fall anywhere above or below the second bolt. After that, the top is great and safe".   Also, clipping the anchor from any hold below the very top of cliff is desperate.

climbs.name: Lycra Perversion
climbs.fa: Eric Hörst, Rick Thompson, Bob Perna, Lisa Hörst

content.description: Start to the left of Heart's Horizon and climb past a funky section. Mover more easily up the corner and then make the crux traverse around the arete to the right. Continue up the arete passing one more cruxy section near the top. Use caution nearing the anchor as the rock qulaity is suspect in spots. The anchor has been lowered a bit due to the dubious rock quality in the vicinity of the existing cold shuts. [-Jonathon Clark]
content.location: Left of Heart's Horizon. Start off arete till it curves left then follow to the top.

content.description:
If you climb 10's you should lead this, exhilarating exposure pulling the roof into a nice diagonal tips crack. 

  It's named for a train that passed by during the crux of Rich Romano's first ascent.  

  It's the next bolted route right of classic Wonderama.
"Follow two bolts through a cruxy alcove. Climb past three more bolts on easier but enjoyable ground to a distinct crux past the sixth bolt to the anchor." [-Jonathon Clark]
content.location: Left of Urban Daydream below arete the curves left. Follow arete but stay on main face.

content.description: Climb bulging rock, staying directly on bolt line for first 2 bolts.  Climb left facing corner using the right wall for a few choice stems to make it easier. At the top move left to anchor with out topping out in alcove.

A wild route. Climb past 6 bolts on funky rock to a stance. At bolt seven you have two options;

 1) Follow the path of least resistance by underclinging out right and then work up the right arete feature.

 2) Manufacture some difficulty by going straight up. This sequence is in the 11+/12- range and is worth doing.

 From the top of the arete pull a somewhat powerful move to the shuts.
content.protection: 9 bolts, ring anchors   hardware has been updated
content.location: Right of the obvious Autumn Arch corner

content.description: Shares the first 3 bolts with Locomotion and Chillin' & Maxin'.  Move right at the 3rd and 4th bolts.  If your footwork isn't good this will feel harder, lots of stemming and counterpressure.  Ends with a mantle onto a comfy little ledge.
content.protection: 8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with rings.
content.location: To the Right of Wonderama - the overhanging left facing arete.

content.description: This is one of the coolest routes Safe Harbor has to offer featuring good moves up a solid shield of orange rock. Start on either the first five bolts of Autumn Arch or on the first five bolts of Expose'. Make a few balancey moves past two bolts to a stance where the wall steepens. Make some athletic moves to another stance (crux) on a thin ledge. Shake and pull one more sequence moving up and right topping out on a large ledge.
content.protection: 10 bolts, two wave glue in bolts for an anchor with quicklinks
content.location: One route right of the obvious Autumn Arch corner system.

content.description: Begins with easy climbing on face right of Wonderama on bolts shared with its neighbors. At third bolt move right, then straight up to the roof after the fourth. Find a solution jug to pull the roof, then climb through the crux on a blunt arete with some slabby mantle moves.
content.protection: 7 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. First 3 shared with Locomotion and Eminent Domain, 4th shared with Eminent Domain. Anchors also shared with Eminent Domain.
content.location: Between Eminent Domain and Locomotion, shares bolts with both and anchors with the former. 4th line in the Autumn Arch Sector.

content.description:
This route is fantastic - varied between the upper and lower halves, long, interesting moves and great stemming! Nice view from the top too.  

  From the Rock & Ice guide published in issue #51: "Mega-classic corner with great stemming. Beware - A 165-foot [50m] rope is required to lower off this, and adjacent routes!"
content.location: Obvious corner a third of the way down the carriage path. Climb #33.

content.description: Routes around Autumn Arch, some of the tallest, steepest and most iconic lines at Safe Harbor South.
